source.name: MCSAP / FMCSA Funding Conditions (A.B.E. summary)
source.notes: Summaries of how federal MCSAP and related FMCSA funds are supposed to be used, framed for ON_MISSION / OFF_MISSION classification.

entries.title: MCSAP — Motor Carrier Safety Assistance Program core purpose
entries.summary: Provides grants to States to assist in enforcement of commercial motor vehicle safety regulations and standards, primarily for CMVs and their drivers.
entries.on_mission_conditions: Funds are used to enforce safety regulations applicable to commercial motor vehicles and commercial drivers, reduce CMV-related crashes, and support CMV safety programs.
entries.off_mission_signals: Funds or personnel financed by MCSAP are used primarily for general state traffic enforcement on non-commercial private drivers, CPS investigations, general criminal patrol, or administrative activities far removed from CMV safety.
entries.funding_on_mission_example: CMV roadside inspections, CMV-focused enforcement blitzes, CMV safety data systems, crash reduction initiatives targeting commercial motor vehicles.
entries.funding_off_mission_example: MCSAP-funded officers spending most of their time issuing tickets for expired license plates, non-commercial driver license issues, or minor speeding infractions in ordinary passenger vehicles.
entries.notes_for_engine: CFF can map spend_category_code=OFF_MISSION when line items clearly fit the off_mission_signals and do not have a plausible CMV safety tie.

entries.title: MCSAP — Non-commercial DMV/traffic operations
entries.summary: Clarifies that non-commercial private passenger vehicles and their drivers are outside the core scope of CMV-focused MCSAP enforcement.
entries.full_text_ref: Compatibility discussions under 49 CFR Part 350 and FMCSA guidance
entries.on_mission_conditions: State can conduct CMV-focused operations even if they occur on roads also used by private drivers, as long as the activities are genuinely directed at CMV safety.
entries.off_mission_signals: Using MCSAP-funded checkpoints, patrols, or task forces to routinely stop and process non-commercial private drivers for issues unrelated to CMV safety (e.g., generic licensing, insurance, minor state traffic violations).
entries.funding_on_mission_example: Combined operations where a CMV safety inspection station is active and non-commercial interactions are incidental and not the primary output.
entries.funding_off_mission_example: Roadblock operations where MCSAP-funded officers largely focus on checking licenses/insurance of ordinary motorists rather than inspecting CMVs.
entries.notes_for_engine: CFF can treat this as an interpretive lens for borderline cases, pushing ambiguous spend into UNCLEAR rather than ON_MISSION when non-commercial enforcement dominates.
